channel.title: Character Titles

item.title: Character Titles
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

voetbal645:

is it added server sided to?

I just found a tutorial for it and I did it all. But, I get an error…

source\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:99: cannot find symbol symbol : method write(java.lang.String,int,int) location: class java.io.BufferedReader characterfile.write("loyalty-rank = ", 0, 15); ^ source\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:100: cannot find symbol symbol : method write(java.lang.String,int,int) location: class java.io.BufferedReader characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.loyaltyRank), 0, Integer ^ source\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:102: cannot find symbol symbol : method newLine() location: class java.io.BufferedReader characterfile.newLine(); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Character Titles
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

Aetoc:

In the character file there should be a loyaltyRank = (number here) and then you just change it to the title number.

There isn’t a loyaltyRank = (number here).

item.title: Character Titles
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

I was looking through my client.java (client sided) and at the very beginning, I came across the Character-Loyalty Titles, or whatever they are called.

		public String getRank(int i){
		switch(i){
			case 1:
			return "Lord";
			case 2:
			return "Sir";
			case 3:
			return "Lionheart";
			case 4:
			return "Desperado";
			case 5:
			return "Bandito";
			case 6:
			return "King";
			case 7:
			return "Big Cheese";
			case 8:
			return "Wunderkind";
			case 9:
			return "Crusader";
			case 10:
			return "Overlord";
			case 11:
			return "Bigwig";
			case 12:
			return "Count";
			case 13:
			return "Duderino";
			case 14:
			return "Hell Raiser";
			case 15:
			return "Baron";
			case 16:
			return "Duke";
			case 17:
			return "Lady";
			case 18:
			return "Dame";
			case 19:
			return "Dudette";
			case 20:
			return "Baroness";
			case 21:
			return "Countess";
			case 22:
			return "Overlordess";
			case 23:
			return "Duchess";
			case 24:
			return "Queen";		
			case 25:
			return "Donator";		
			case 26:
			return "Extreme Donator";		
			case 27:
			return "Veteran";		
			case 28:
			return "Owner";		
			case 29:
			return "Co-Owner";
			case 30:
			return "Trusted-Dice";
			case 31:
			return "Trusted";
			case 32:
			return "Dicer";
			case 33:
			return "AdminLikeBaws";
		}
		return "";
	}

How do I make a player have a title?

Read full topic
